ColorPrint

A builtin module for printing colored text to the terminal using ANSI escape codes

ColorPrint::​Fore

Module containing the foreground color codes used for printing colors

Constants
Color names
black

black color

red

red color

green

green color

yellow

yellow color

blue

blue color

magenta

magenta color

cyan

cyan color

white

white color

brightBlack

brightBlack color

brightRed

brightRed color

brightGreen

brightGreen color

brightYellow

brightYellow color

brightBlue

brightBlue color

brightMagenta

brightMagenta color

brightCyan

brightCyan color

brightWhite

brightWhite color

ColorPrint::​Back

Module containing the background color codes used for printing colors

Constants
Color names
black

black color

red

red color

green

green color

yellow

yellow color

blue

blue color

magenta

magenta color

cyan

cyan color

white

white color

brightBlack

brightBlack color

brightRed

brightRed color

brightGreen

brightGreen color

brightYellow

brightYellow color

brightBlue

brightBlue color

brightMagenta

brightMagenta color

brightCyan

brightCyan color

brightWhite

brightWhite color

resetColor

ANSI escape code to reset all color formatting back to terminal defaults

Functions
colorPrint
colorPrint:: (
s
: 
string,
col
: 
string
)

Prints a string to the terminal with the specified color, then resets color formatting

Parameters
s
string

The string to print

col
string

The color code to use (use one of the color constants defined in this module)
